title: Russian attacks on DIY store , city center in Ukraine Kharkiv kill 6 , injure dozens
message:
Russian strikes on a crowded DIY hardware store and a residential area in the Ukrainian city of Kharkiv on Saturday killed at least six people and injured dozens, local officials said.
"The attack targeted the shopping center, where there were many people - this is clearly terrorism," Terekhov said.
Firefighters battle blazeAndriy Kudinov, director of the suburban shopping center, told local media the hardware store was full of shoppers buying items for their summer cottages.
Huge clouds of dark smoke billowed into the sky over the shopping center.
Witnesses described panicked scenes at the shopping center.
event_breakdown:
Security Events:
- Russian strikes on DIY hardware store in Ukrainian city of Kharkiv on Saturday.
- Russian strikes on residential area in Ukrainian city of Kharkiv on Saturday.
- Russian attack on suburban shopping center in Kharkiv on Saturday.
- Fire broke out at shopping center in Kharkiv on Saturday.
- Firefighters battled blaze at shopping center.
- Many shoppers buying items for their summer cottages present in shopping center when struck by russian.
- Dark smoke billowed into the sky over the shopping center.
- Witnesses described panicked scenes at the shopping center. - Russian strikes targeted the suburban shopping center in Kharkiv.

title: Russian strikes on Kharkiv kill at least 6 , injure dozens
message:
Kharkiv Mayor Ihor Terekhov said about 120 people were in the hardware store when the bombs struck.
Kharkiv, Ukraine second-largest city, is about 30 kilometers from the Russian border and has come under attack for a few weeks as Russian forces have made a push into the northeast region as it tests Ukraine’s defenses along the front line farther south in the Donetsk region.
Ukrainian shelling in BelgorodMeanwhile, Ukrainian shelling on the Belgorod region, about 10 kilometers from the border, killed four people Saturday, Belgorod region Governor Vyacheslav Gladkov said.
Zelenskyy said that Ukrainian forces managed to take combat control of border areas in northern parts of Kharkiv where Russian troops launched an attack this month.
Vodolatskiy was quoted by the state-run Tass news agency as saying Russian forces controlled more than half the territory of the town of Vovchansk, five kilometers inside the Ukrainian border.
event_breakdown:
1. Russian troops launched an attack in the Kharkiv region in northern Ukraine.
2. Four people were killed by Ukrainian shelling in the Belgorod region.
3. Ukrainian president Volodymyr Zelenskyy said Ukrainian forces managed to take control of border areas of northern Kharkiv.
4. Tass news agency in Russia said Russian forces controlled more than half the territory of Vovchansk, five kilometers inside the Ukrainian border.

title: Russian attack on Kharkiv shopping centre  utterly unacceptable , says senior UN official Global Issues
message:
“I am appalled and shocked by the terrifying news arriving from Kharkiv”, said Ms. Brown in a statement.
The strike hit a busy shopping centre with scores of civilian casualties and massive damage to civilian facilities”.
The senior UN official added that attacks by Russian forces hitting civilians and civilian infrastructure must stop, and noted that intentionally directing an attack against civilian infrastructure is strictly prohibited under international humanitarian law.
According to UN sources, a second attack on Saturday is believed to have caused some 12 casualties.
Following Russian advances, the northeastern Kharkiv region is now on the frontline of the war in Ukraine.
event_breakdown:
1. 24 April 2022 | Kharkiv, Ukraine: Dozens killed as Russian forces bomb a shopping and cinema complex.
2. 25 April 2022 | Kharkiv, Ukraine: Dozens reported injured in Russian mortar attack.

title: Multiple people killed , dozens injured in Russian airstrike on Ukraine shopping center – KTBB News , Weather , Talk
message:
Multiple people killed, dozens injured in Russian airstrike on Ukraine shopping centerPosted/updated on: May 25, 2024 at 4:09 pmGetty Image - STOCK(UKRAINE) -- Russian forces struck a Ukrainian shopping center in Kharkiv on Saturday, leaving four people dead and 38 people wounded according to local officials.
Oleh Synyehubov, the Kharkiv governor, said on Ukrainian television that they have so far identified 16 people as officially missing.
Synyehubov also said there was a second strike in Kharkiv that injured 12 people, including a 13-year-old boy.
Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said 200 people were believed to have been in the shopping center when the attack happened.
"If Ukraine had enough air defense and modern combat aircraft, such Russian strikes would simply be impossible.
event_breakdown:
1. Four people were killed and 38 people injured in a Russian airstrike on a shopping centre in Kharkiv on Saturday.
2. Second strike in Kharkiv injured 12 people, including a 13-year-old boy.
3. 200 people were believed to have been in the shopping centre at the time of the attack.

title: Zelenskyy : Ukraine takes back control in areas of Kharkiv region | News , Sports , Jobs
message:
KYIV, Ukraine (AP) — Ukrainian forces have secured “combat control” of areas where Russian troops entered the northeastern Kharkiv region earlier this month, President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said.
Kharkiv is about 12 miles from the Russian border.
Vovchansk has been a flashpoint for fighting since Russia launched the offensive in the Kharkiv region.
Russian President Vladimir Putin has said the Kremlin’s army is attempting to create a “buffer zone” in the Kharkiv region to prevent Ukrainian cross-border attacks.
In addition to the ground offensive operation along Ukraine’s northeastern border, Russia is continuing to bombard the Kharkiv region with missiles, guided aerial bombs and drones.
event_breakdown:
* Ukrainian forces have gained control of areas in which Russian troops entered northeastern Kharkiv, Ukraine.
* The Kharkiv region has been experiencing intense fighting since Russia launched its offensive in the region.
* Russia's objective is to invade Ukraine to create "buffer zones" and prevent cross-border attacks.
* Kharkiv has been bombarded by missiles, guided aerial bombs, and drones.

title: At least four killed and others missing after Russia strikes hardware store in Kharkiv
message:
By Maria Kostenko and Radina Gigova and Darya Tarasova, CNN(CNN) — At least four people have been killed and 33 injured after a Russian strike hit a large hardware store in Kharkiv, Ukraine, on Saturday, according to officials.
Officials have said there were nearly 200 people inside the building when the strike occurred.
However there were still people inside the building,” Oleh Syniehubov, the head of the Kharkiv regional military administration, said Saturday in an interview on national television.
Seven people were killed in Russian strikes on the city Thursday, after locations including a printing house were targeted.
Every day we call on the world: give us air defense, save people.
event_breakdown:
1. At least four people were killed and 33 injured after a Russian strike hit a large hardware store in Kharkiv, Ukraine, on Saturday, according to officials.
2. Officials said there were nearly 200 people inside the building when the strike occurred, but there were still people inside the building.

title: Netanyahu : Israel has  Surprising  Plans for Hezbollah | The Jewish Press - JewishPress . com | Jewish News Syndicate ( JNS ) | 18 Iyyar 5784 – Sunday , May 26 , 2024
message:

Hezbollah terrorists fired a barrage of around 30 rockets from southern Lebanon at the Upper Galilee on Thursday.
According to the Upper Galilee Regional Council, there were no injuries, though the rockets caused several fires.
Hezbollah took credit for the salvo, saying that it had fired “dozens of Katyushas” at a military base.
Hezbollah has carried out near-daily attacks on Israel since joining the war against the Jewish state.

title: At least four killed and others missing after Russia strikes hardware store in Kharkiv
message:
CNN —At least four people have been killed and 33 injured after a Russian strike hit a large hardware store in Kharkiv, Ukraine, on Saturday, according to officials.
“The air raid siren went off and some people managed to get out of the building, roughly 100 people.
However there were still people inside the building,” Oleh Syniehubov, the head of the Kharkiv regional military administration, said Saturday in an interview on national television.
“There is not a single military object nearby,” he added.
Seven people were killed in Russian strikes on the city Thursday, after locations including a printing house were targeted.
event_breakdown:
Events:
- Russian military has struck a large hardware store in Kharkiv, Ukraine.
- 33 people were wounded in the attack.
- Several people were saved by a air raid siren.
- Regional officials claim there was still people inside the store after the attack.
- An official states there was no nearby military objects.

title: UN official condemns Russian strike against Kharkiv hypermarket
message:
Russian forces attacked a busy building materials hypermarket in Kharkiv with two guided bombs in the middle of the day on May 25, killing at least six people and injuring at least 40 others.
The strike hit a busy shopping centre with scores of civilian casualties and massive damage to civilian facilities."
The bombing of the hypermarket comes amid intensifying attacks against Kharkiv.
Russian forces regularly conduct ground shelling and aerial attacks against population centers in Kharkiv Oblast.
Read also: Russia’s latest offensive into Kharkiv Oblast is stretching Ukrainian defensesWe’ve been working hard to bring you independent, locally-sourced news from Ukraine.
event_breakdown:
- Russian forces attacked a building materials hypermarket in Kharkiv, Ukraine, on May 25, 2022, killing at least six people, injuring at least 40 others, and destroying scores of apartment buildings.
- This attack follows the intensified ground shelling and aerial attacks that Russian forces have been conducting against population centers in Kharkiv Oblast.

title: Russian strike on Kharkiv DIY store kills six : governor
message:
Kharkiv regional governor Oleg Synegubov said on Telegram that six people "died on the spot", 40 were wounded and 16 missing after two guided Russian bombs hit the store.
- 'Brutal blow' -Later Saturday, another strike hit the centre of Kharkiv, wounding 14 in an area containing a post office, a hairdresser and a cafe, the city's mayor Igor Terekhov said.
The latest attacks came after Russia launched a ground offensive in the Kharkiv region on May 10.
- Border strikes -Russia and Ukraine accused each others' forces of attacks in the border area Saturday.
Ukraine said Russia shelled the village of Kupiansk-Vuzlovyi, a railway hub in the Kharkiv region near the border, wounding five, the regional prosecutor's office said.
event_breakdown: - Russia bombs a shopping centre in Kharkiv, killing at least six people, wounding 40 and destroying a post office, hairdressers and cafes. - On Saturday, Russia launched the first ground attack in the Kharkiv region May 10, on the same day that a Russian strike wounded 14 Ukrainians in the centre of Kharkiv. - Both sides accused each other of shelling on the border.

title: At least four killed and others missing after Russia strikes hardware store in Kharkiv
message:
At least four killed and others missing after Russia strikes hardware store in KharkivValentyn Ogirenko/Reuters via CNN NewsourceBy Maria Kostenko and Radina Gigova and Darya Tarasova(CNN) — At least four people have been killed and 33 injured after a Russian strike hit a large hardware store in Kharkiv, Ukraine, on Saturday, according to officials.
Officials have said there were nearly 200 people inside the building when the strike occurred.
“The air raid siren went off and some people managed to get out of the building, roughly 100 people.
However there were still people inside the building,” Oleh Syniehubov, the head of the Kharkiv regional military administration, said Saturday in an interview on national television.
Seven people were killed in Russian strikes on the city Thursday, after locations including a printing house were targeted.

title: Gross Display Of Antisemitism : Jewish Elementary School In Canada Toronto Hit By Gunfire
message:
A Jewish girls’ school in Toronto, Canada was hit by gunfire early Saturday, without causing any injuries but prompting authorities to step up security at other schools and synagogues.
Police increased their presence in the school’s north Toronto neighborhood, as well as at other schools and synagogues, Krawczyk said.
“Reports of shots fired at a Jewish elementary school in North York are despicable — a brazen act of antisemitism,” said Prime Minister Justin Trudeau.
The shooting comes amid the war in Gaza sparked by Palestinian militant group Hamas’s unprecedented October 7 attack on Israel.
In November, a Jewish school in Montreal was hit by gunfire twice in one week.
event_breakdown:
Reports of shots fired at a Jewish elementary school in North York, Toronto, Canada, early Saturday.
Reports of a brazen act of antisemitism at a Toronto school by shooting at a Jewish girls’ school.
